alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 325 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Dry Ridge, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Fairfield, Forest Park, Sharonville, Blue Ash, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, North College Hill, Madeira, Wyoming, Mount Healthy, Deer Park, Finneytown, West Chester, Ross, Taylor Creek, Highpoint and Dry Ridge. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 11 and 18. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 8 and 15. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 9 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
